name: K2-237
scenarioDescription:
The K2-237 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-237 is a star with 1.23 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 1009.45282 light years away from the solar system.

K2-237 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-237 system

K2-237 b

K2-237 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the Transit method. The mass of K2-237 b is 392.83788 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-237 b is 18.405 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-237 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-237 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-237, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
